title: Ten Million Aliens - Simon Barnes
description:
â€œFunny, thoughtful, informative, and wiseâ€ (Publishers Weekly, starred review), this scientific foray into the animal kingdom examines how the worldâ€™s creaturesâ€”weird, wonderful, and everything in betweenâ€”are inextricably linked.

Life on planet earth is not weirder than we imagine. Itâ€™s weirder than we are capable of imagining. And weâ€™re all in it together: humans, blue whales, rats, birds of paradise, beetles, mollusks the size of buses, gladiator slugs, bdelloid rotifers that havenâ€™t had sex for millions of years, and water bearsâ€”creatures that can be boiled, frozen, and fired off into space without dying.

Weâ€™re all part of the animal kingdom, appearing in what Darwin called â€œendless forms most beautiful and most wonderful.â€ In this audacious book, Simon Barnes brings together all of the worldâ€™s creatures, seeking not what sets them all apart but what unites them all.
